reviews.title: Great base and retreat from the city
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel Fortyseven with our kids and got the family package which worked out as great value. The adjoining rooms were immaculately clean and had everything you could need or want from a hotel room. The service was consistently good and we loved the rooftop restaurant as a great retreat from the hubbub of the city. The only thing I would do differently nexttime is request a room that is a bit removed from the traffic noise. Rome is nonstop, and the traffic keeps on going right through the night! The hotel location is brilliant for getting to the colosseum, forum and palatine on foot, but it is on a major road coming into the city.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay!!
reviews.text: My husband and I recently went to Rome for our honeymoon and stayed at Hotel Fortyseven. Everything about it was great. When we first arrived we were greeted at the front reception area by a very nice woman and while we checked in with her, another hotel staff member brought all of our luggage up to our room for us. The breakfast was very good as well as the rooftop bar. Everyone who worked here spoke very good English and all were extremely nice. When asked for good restaurants to eat at, they marked it on the map for us and every one that they recommended was fabulous food!! They were very nice to call for cabs when we needed them and also were right on time with wake up calls. The room was cleaned every day, with fresh linens on the bed and towels in the bathroom. Our one week stay was very pleasant and we will definately be back!!

reviews.title: Wonderful stay!
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderful and is near the Colosseum and Trastevere. The breakfast was delicious with hot and cold choices available.

reviews.title: Great location - friendly boutique hotel
reviews.text: Requested a room with terrace and we were lucky. A lovely little West-facing terrace, just perfect for recharging between daytime outings and evening jaunts. Wonderful shower-room (we asked for shower not tub)and huge comfortable bed. Having booked a deluxe room we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel reduced the final bill as they were worried the room they'd given us was smaller than other deluxe rooms without terraces.

reviews.title: A home away from home
reviews.text: All the staff were very friendly and helpful without being obsequious and we made use of their airport car service - took all the stress out of transport.

reviews.title: Best Western Quality For Westin Excelsior Prices
reviews.text: We came here after spending 5 in Florence at the Westin Excelsior. The Westin was $465 per night including buffet breakfast for 2. Large room, large bathroom with tub, amazing service.

reviews.title: excelent choice.
reviews.text: The Fortyseven Hotel in comparison was a major disappointment for $421.12 per night for their deluxe room.

reviews.title: Love this property!
reviews.text: We pulled up to the hotel by taxi and received zero help in lugging our luggage up the stairs. There is no reception desk, just 2 disinterested girls sitting at little desks with laptops. We sat and checked in. Handed one key. I asked for another and was told they were all out of keys. Asked about restaurants and was told the concierge would not be in until 4:00pm. Showed to our room and told that the key was needed to run the electricity. I asked how the a/c worked and was told by the "bellman" that he didn't know.

reviews.title: Fantastic rooms and excellent staff, worth every penny!
reviews.text: The room was ok, ultra modern and trying too hard to be hip and cool. A poor imitation of the Renaissance in Times Square.

reviews.title: Unbelieveable hospitality
reviews.text: Cleaned up and went downstairs to try and find lunch. The girl at the "desk" was less than interested and told us if we made a right out of the hotel and went to the Piazza Venezia we might find some very nice restaurants. If by nice she meant tourist traps serving overpriced food she was correct. We finally settled on a place that had good prosciutto and melon, adequate salad, and pizza hut quality pizza.

reviews.title: Great hotel for sound sleepers
reviews.text: We spent a wonderful time in Rome staying at this centrally located hotel for five nights. We booked a deluxe room and were not disappointed - spacious & modern, with a comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. Breakfast was good too, as was the friendly service. Our only qualm was the traffic, which races down the cobbled Via Petroselli day and night. Still this didn't bother us too much and a small price to pay for the wonderful views.

reviews.title: Great choice for a short stay in Rome
reviews.text: Great location: walking distance to the Colloseum, Venice Square. Also, just a few minutes walk to Trastevere area where you HAVE to go for some great dining

reviews.title: A nice find - worth considering
reviews.text: Room was very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful and gave a lot of useful tips.

reviews.title: Great location, best view ever
reviews.text: Nice breakfast and the roof top restaurant has been an excellent choice for a warmer spring evening - nice views, great atmosphere

reviews.title: Great location - even better for dinner
reviews.text: We spent two nights here just before Easter and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel describes itself as boutique and I would agree. If you're looking for clean, comfortable, modern accommodation with a nice bathroom and reliable air-conditioning then this may be the place for you. Public rooms are small and you wouldn't want to spend a long time in them. Staff are generally attentive and responsive, occasionally friendly and cheerful. We didn't eat in the top floor restaurant so cannot comment. The breakfast could have been better for a four star hotel. There was a fresh fruit salad, juice, cereals, bread, croissant, jams & spreads. A little cheese and one cold meat. The hot seletion was poor in my view, scrambled agg and chopped frankfurters floating in water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was okay, we stayed in the suite and obviously it was a good sized room. The terrace is a good touch and we ate out on there for a few times. The concierge wasnt much help and didnt really notice our rooms being tidied or anything when we were out.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, service not particularly great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel was location as it is close to alot of tourist sites and is just opposite a bus stop.
reviews.title: Brilliant, clean and tasteful hotel
great hotel in every way
reviews.text: Will definitely go to Rome again, but for the money, I could probably go to a place that offered better service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fortyseven Hotel without knowing anything about it beforehand. I was extremely pleased when we arrived: it was clean, airy, with beautiful wooden floors in our room, and a travertine bathroom. The breakfast was lovely and fresh with excellent coffee, and breakfast tables were covered in very clean white linen. The only point I could fault them on would be the lack of a mirrored dressing table in rooms, and the unavailability of a plug adapter. However, we are returning to Rome in a week's time, and have re-booked the hotel for a second visit. Very pleasing hotel!
reviews.title: A sense of humour is everything

reviews.text: We loved our stay at forty seven. The room was large, modern, and very clean. The king size bed (rare for Rome) was a welcomed bonus for tired travelers. The staff was pleasant, informative, and extremely helpful. The breakfast was great and even had hot items. Would not hesitate to stay there again. The location was great (easy walk to everything). Also, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel. Note: do not take taxis as they will rip you off (they do not reset the meter, don't have change, take you the long way etc.- take bus 170 from train station right to the hotel!
reviews.title: Still superb - again!
Perfect!
reviews.text: We stayed in Suite 508 which was simply beautiful, a huge bathroom a master bedroom and a sitting room with a pull out bed for our 19 year old daughter. All of the rooms opened up to a beautiful balcony over looking the mouth of truth the Temple of Hercules, in sight of Circus Maximus the sunsets each night were beautiful. Talk about location we walked to just about everything with the exception of the Vatican. This was our first trip to Rome which we plan to do again at the same place. Six nights were just not enough to do all we wanted. The staff were very helpful with our every request.

reviews.title: Fantastic Experience
reviews.text: We were recently "stranded" for an extra 5 nights at Fortyseven Hotel in Rome. While the transportation industry took every opportunity to take advantage of the situation, Fortyseven offered us a decreased special rate to help us out. This huge gesture turned out to be only one of the many things the management and staff did to ensure an excellent stay in Rome.

reviews.title: Fantastic Location with modern rooms and good service
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a perfect location for sights and dinning, with extremely comfortable rooms. Every member of staff treated us like VIPs, and when out of their way to make sure we had a great time in Rome.

reviews.title: Possibly the worst service I have ever encountered in a hotel.
reviews.text: I would strongly recommend Fortyseven, and look forward to our return.

reviews.title: The Perfect Place to stay in Rome
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights on holiday and found the location to be excellent for sightseeing, we walked everywhere from the hotel even to the Vatican city. The hotel is situated nicely between the area with the ancient ruins and the restaurant district of Trastevere and the Jewish ghetto which also has great food. The staff gave us good dining recommendations. Rooms are modern and clean. There is some road noise at times but once the shutters are drawn down it is okay. We found the rooftop bar a nice place to have an evening drink before or after dinner. Finally, we were very thankful to the hotel staff for helping us with internet access and searching local travel options for getting out of Rome and back home during the Volcano ash cloud air crisis. We managed to get the overnight train from Rome to Paris and then finally back to London. This would have been much more difficult without the help of the staff. The staff also offered to help us find lodging within our budget (as the hotel is expensive without an advance special rate) in case we needed to extend our stay. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights back in late September. The location of the hotel is perfect for seeing all the major sites. We walked everywhere and thoroughly enjoyed Rome.
reviews.title: Great Location, Service Issues, Overpriced
Good in parts, but some issues
reviews.text: The check-in staff was friendly and helpful. We were put in into a room with 2 twin beds and asked to be moved to one with a king sized bed. They showed us a few other rooms, but ultimately, we decided to stick with the original room and have them push the beds together...no big deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice and modern. The mattresses on the other hand are a bit on the "firm" side. I normally prefer a firmer mattress, but honestly, these were excessive.
reviews.title: Loved Rome and 47

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The daily breakfast was nice enough. Service was good and they had plenty of offerings.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.text: We asked the concierge to make us reservations on 2 occasions. We mentioned that we wanted a typically "Roman" experience. She ended up sending us to what I would consider a very "atypical" Roman eatery. It was ultra modern and very frou frou. Don't get me wrong, normally I would enjoy that, but being from NYC, I can experience that any time I want. To make matters worse, she sent us to the exact same restaurant the following night. Needless to say, we did not eat there on either occasion. Considering the fact that we had given her a 10 Euro tip, I would have expected more.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location without breaking the bank

reviews.text: Before leaving on this trip I had read all the reviews on this hotel. All I can say is that they were all true! I rate this property at the top of my list! The hotel is ultra-modern and has everything you need. Everything in the room is operated by electrical switches, including the closing of the shutters, blinds, A/C, lights. It has all the amenities that all first class hotels have in the United States. We arranged through the concierge to be picked up at the airport and that was less expensive and easier than other quotes I had received through other services, (although the driver did not speak English). He had a sign and knew exactly where we were going. One day we were leaving the hotel extremely early and knew that we would miss breakfast. They arranged a brown bag breakfast and it was waiting for us at the front desk at 6:30AM! All of the staff are helpful. The location is very good, at night quiet. This hotel is walking distance to a lot of points of interest. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the nicest hotels in which I have stayed, and I have been in Ritz's, Mandarin Oriental's, etc.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels ever!!

reviews.text: The hotel decor was modern and the room beautiful and spacious. The bathroom was huge with top quality fixtures.
reviews.title: Great again - the second time around

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant one evening and it was one of the better meals that we had in Italy. The staff were all friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Forty seven shone in the Oct sun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From this hotel, the Coliseum area is a 15 minute walk; the Vatican and Borghese both maybe 30 minutes with a billion or two sights in between.
reviews.title: Would return in a heartbeat

likes.disliked: — A little pricey - but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after a long mixed up plane trip the 47 hotel was all we expected it to be. modern and clean and very comfortable. we were able to walk to all the sites and stroll across the tiber in the evening for dinner in the trastevere section of town. all at the hotel were helpful and concerned, as the airline lost our luggage for 5 days. staff advised us on where to shop for some items to tide us over. the staff called the airline each day to see if our luggage had been located .we didn't have to both with any details they took care of everything. the breakfast in the morning was great there was a nice variety of foods hot and cold. the service was excellent the waitress and waiters couldn't do enough for us. when we go back to rome the 47 hotel is the place we will be staying at. just loved it.
